intro: Parabenzoin praecox f. angustifolium, commonly known as narrow-leaved parabenzoin, is a botanical variant characterized by its slender, elongated leaves. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is native to specific regions in Southeast Asia. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a fragrant aroma. The leaves and flowers are used in traditional medicine for their purported therapeutic properties.
